bibl.title: Greek Ostraca from Elephantine.
bibl.note: Ptolemaic tax receipts from Elephantine show, towards the end of the third century B.C., a significant breach with the previous custom of tax collection, which shifted from the involvement of the Egyptian personnel on Elephantine to that of the Greek bank in Syene. Demotic is again used in tax receipts by local praktores in the early Roman empire.

bibl.title: The First Cataract of the Nile. One Region - Diverse Perspectives

bibl.seg: Ruth Duttenhöfer, Greek Ostraca from Elephantine.

Dietrich Raue, Stephan J. Seidlmayer & Philipp Speiser (edd.), The First Cataract of the Nile. One Region - Diverse Perspectives = Deutsches Archäologisches Institut. Abteilung Kairo. Sonderschrift 36 (Berlin - Boston, 2013) pp. 53-58, 3 tabl.

Ptolemaic tax receipts from Elephantine show, towards the end of the third century B.C., a significant breach with the previous custom of tax collection, which shifted from the involvement of the Egyptian personnel on Elephantine to that of the Greek bank in Syene. Demotic is again used in tax receipts by local praktores in the early Roman empire.
